channel.title: Introduction :: K-State CIS 580 Textbook
channel.description: By this point you have probably built a lot of programs with user interfaces. Most, or possibly all, were written in an event-driven fashion, i.e. you created a method to serve as an event handler, i.e.: public void OnButtonPress(object sender, EventArgs e) { // Your logic here... } This approach is a good fit for most productivity desktop applications. After all, most of the time your text editor is just waiting for you to do something interesting - like move the mouse or type a letter.
